title: is it against the rules to use macros?
body: i recently purchased a nice razer keyboard, and as ive started checking out all of its nifty features ive found out it has a macro system which i could set up to press q>w>e>r>f as a combo if i wanted and i was wondering if its against the rules to use the in-built macro system that some keyboards come with, i didn't even know keyboards could do such things! so amazement

replies.body:
best macro is leblanc DFG>q>r>e 
one button to insta gib
Regular keyboards can do it too if you install programs.

thanks for the knowledge :P

any idea if its against the rules however? i rather like my league account un-banned haha.

I'm assuming you haven't been banned and are worried about being banned. Not that you have been banned and are hoping that somehow asking about this will unban you. I would imagine a combo macro would be bannable as that's considered automation. I don't know though. Send a Support ticket in.

lol nah i havent been banned, i was just asking here before i went to riot, im assuming theyd find out some day if i went ahead an used a macro and wasnt allowed, and i know in WoW macros are insta-ban no warning no account recovery, so i'd rather be safe, ty for your time.

In WoW macros are allowed as long as it's not for extended periods of time. I have a milling macro for instance that I'll run in 20 minute chunks. You're also allowed combo macros in WoW afaik.  You used to be anyway.

> In WoW macros are allowed as long as it's not for extended periods of time. I have a milling macro for instance that I'll run in 20 minute chunks. You're also allowed combo macros in WoW afaik.  You used to be anyway.

WoW has always had a 1 key press, one spell limit on macros.
Things not on the GCD have always been excepted, so you could macro AP,PoM,Pyro, or NS, Healing Touch to get instant speed spells off in one press. 
Any chains like full DPS rotations have always been limited to cast sequences, where pressing the same button over and over stepped through your rotation, but you needed to press the button each time you wanted to cast a spell.

The closest thing to an exception to this was there was a mob in Gnomeragon that if you mind controlled it, had a damage spell off the GCD. You could write a macro to cast that spell ~200 times, then another macro to call the 1st macro, and a 3rd macro to call the 2nd ~200 times (loops wouldnt work though). And you could press the button your screen would freeze up for a second and you'd and shoot 10,000 spanners at once, one shotting anything, but it only worked in a low level instance so it wasn't of any practical value.
5 years of playing WOW with an addon for macroing spells into combos and never banned...

i believe what i called a macro many of you consider "bots" my apologies for the confusion, i'm not talking about the little macros you get off of curse when i say insta-ban in wow, i'm talking about the 1-90 (or 1-100) leveling/quests bots, i just wasn't sure if riot considered macros and bots to be along the same lines and wouldn't discriminate between the two when banning,

either way ive sent in a ticket asking so its all good :)

Bots are against the TOU/EULA (which you've agreed to in order to play). Macros should be fine as long as you don't use them in tournaments (for example the open ladder) or professional play (I'm confident they'd be banned in pro play). If I'm not mistaken there's no mention of macros in the TOU or EULA.

I am almost certain that they have a statement somewhere claiming that if pressing a key results in the action of more than one other key, it isn't allowed. For example a Lux macro that did q,e,r in quick succession is not allowed (I think) since you have pressed one key, and done 3 actions in return.

I recall this is how it is for scripting and such as you can't have anything other than X = Y when you press a button.
